channel.title: Man and the multitude
channel.description:
A lecture series commemorating the centennial of the University of Illinois.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Galbraith discussion, part two
item.description: This program presents the second part of a discussion of John Kenneth Galbraith's lecture, with Norman Graebner; James Heins; Martin Wagner; Margaret Reid of University of Chicago; and Robert Eisner of Northwestern University.
item.dc:creator: University of Illinois
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Daniel J. Boorstin discussion, part two
item.description: This program presents the second part of a discussion of Daniel J. Boorstin's lecture, "The Culture of Communications."Additional speakers include Rita Simon, James W. Carey, H.E. Gulley, all of University of Illinois; and Fred S. Siebert, Michigan State University.
item.dc:creator: University of Illinois
item.dc:subject: U.S. Politics

item.title: Galbraith discussion, part one
item.description: This program presents the first part of a discussion of John Kenneth Galbraith's lecture, with Norman Graebner; James Heins; Martin Wagner; Margaret Reid of University of Chicago; and Robert Eisner of Northwestern University.
item.dc:creator: University of Illinois
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: George Wald, part two
item.description: This program presents the second part of a lecture by George Wald, Harvard University, on "The Human Enterprise: A Scientist's View."
item.dc:creator: University of Illinois
item.dc:subject: Wald, George, 1906-1997

item.title: John Kenneth Galbraith, part two
item.description: This program presents the second part of a lecture by John Kenneth Galbraith, professor of economics, Harvard University, on "Individual and Organization in the Industrial State."
item.dc:creator: University of Illinois
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Peter Viereck discussion, part one
item.description: This program presents the first part of a discussion of Peter Viereck's lecture, "The Fight for Creativity and Personality in a Machine Age." Additional speakers include Gary Adelman, Billy Jackson, Royal MacDonald, Joseph Gusfield, Karl Wallace, all of the University of Illinois; and James McGarrell of Indiana University.
item.dc:creator: University of Illinois
item.dc:subject: Viereck, Peter, 1916-2006

item.title: George Wald, part one
item.description: This program presents the first part of a lecture by George Wald, Harvard University, on "The Human Enterprise: A Scientist's View."
item.dc:creator: University of Illinois
item.dc:subject: Wald, George, 1906-1997

item.title: Discussion of Long and Gustafson lectures, part two
item.description: This program presents the second part of a discussion of lectures by Norton Long and James Gustafson. Speakers include Morris Davis, Benjamin Garrison, Harry Tiebout (all of the University of Illinois); Marcus Singer, University of Wisconsin; and Richard Brandt, University of Michigan.
item.dc:creator: University of Illinois
item.dc:subject: U.S. Politics

item.title: Peter Viereck, part one
item.description: This program presents the first part of a lecture by Peter Viereck, Mount Holyoke College and Pulitzer Prize winner, on "The Fight for Creativity and Personality in a Machine Age."
item.dc:creator: University of Illinois
item.dc:subject: Viereck, Peter, 1916-2006

item.title: Daniel J. Boorstin discussion, part one
item.description: This program presents the first part of a discussion of Daniel J. Boorstin's lecture, "The Culture of Communications."Additional speakers include Rita Simon, James W. Carey, H.E. Gulley, all of University of Illinois; and Fred S. Siebert, Michigan State University.
item.dc:creator: University of Illinois
item.dc:subject: U.S. Politics

item.title: Norton Long and James Gustafson, part one
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, presents lectures by Norton Long of Brandeis University on "Political Reality and Individual Responsibility" and James Gustafson of Yale University on "Morality and Religion: Sustaining or Restraining?"
item.dc:creator: University of Illinois
item.dc:subject: U.S. Politics

item.title: Norton Long and James Gustafson, part two
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, presents lectures by Norton Long of Brandeis University on "Political Reality and Individual Responsibility" and James Gustafson of Yale University on "Morality and Religion: Sustaining or Restraining?"
item.dc:creator: University of Illinois
item.dc:subject: U.S. Politics

item.title: George Wald discussion, part two
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, presents a discussion of a George Wald lecture. Speakers include Ross Ashby; Heinz von Foerster; Melvin Sabshin; and David Pines, all of the University of Illinois.
item.dc:creator: University of Illinois
item.dc:subject: Wald, George, 1906-1997

item.title: Peter Viereck, part two
item.description: This program presents the second part of a lecture by Peter Viereck, Mount Holyoke College and Pulitzer Prize winner, on "The Fight for Creativity and Personality in a Machine Age."
item.dc:creator: University of Illinois
item.dc:subject: Viereck, Peter, 1916-2006

item.title: George Wald discussion, part one
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, presents a discussion of a George Wald lecture. Speakers include Ross Ashby; Heinz von Foerster; Melvin Sabshin; and David Pines, all of the University of Illinois.
item.dc:creator: University of Illinois
item.dc:subject: Wald, George, 1906-1997

item.title: Constantinos Doxiadis, part one
item.description: This program presents the first part of a lecture by Constantinos Doxiadis, prominent architect, city planner, and winner of the Aspen Award, on "Man in the City of the Future."
item.dc:creator: University of Illinois
item.dc:subject: Speeches, addresses, etc
